page.title: 02 WAITROSE
page.content: We interviewed the manager of Waitrose, the largest food supermarket serving Sheen and surrounding areas. It employs up to 170 people, 70 full-time, 35 part-time and the rest made up of students at weekends and evenings. All part-time staff are local, as are some full-time staff. It covers 1200 square feet of shop area, which is average for such shops. Most customers are local, but some shop on their way home from work. The store gets up to 40 deliveries a day from a central warehouse in Bracknell, plus some straight from manufacturers (six different suppliers of bakery products alone!) They sell a large range of branded goods as well as own-brand goods, some of which are by the same makers as the branded produce. Average bill - 6 pounds; average price - 57 pence.
